title: FE: Disable "Edit Policy" button for inherited policies
description:
## Why are we doing this work
- with inherited policies showing up on the policies list, a user should not be able to edit the inherited policy from its current location (e.g. this project/group/namespace/instance). They must go to the group/namespace/instance level to change the policy so they understand the consequences


## Relevant links
![read only drawer](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/uploads/f07bd2cdf96415ae49bf4b85cdfc3e63/mvc-group-level-drawer-open-readonly.png)


## Non-functional requirements
- [ ] Documentation:
- [ ] Testing:


## Implementation plan
- [ ] ~frontend modify [scan_execution_policies graphql query](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/master/ee/app/assets/javascripts/threat_monitoring/graphql/queries/scan_execution_policies.query.graphql) to retrieve source information (whether it was inherited or not)
- [ ] ~frontend modify [policy_drawer.vue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/master/ee/app/assets/javascripts/threat_monitoring/components/policy_drawer/policy_drawer.vue) to conditionally disable the `Edit policy` button

title: Internal development environment variable conflicts with customer variables
description:
### Summary

The API Security scanner supports two database backends, sql and postgresql. An undocumented environment variable allows switching between the two for testing/development purposes. The name of this environment variable (`DB_TYPE`) is generic enough as to have conflicts with users configurations causing failures of API Security.

The issue was found through a customer support case where the scanner never starts causing the job to fail. It looks like the customer has a global variable `DB_TYPE` set for their own existing jobs. When they tried to configure DAST API it caused the scanner background process to fail with an unknown database type error.

Zendesk Ticket: https://gitlab.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/247646

### Steps to reproduce

1. Set `DB_TYPE` global variable to `mysql`.
1. Run API Security products (DAST API or API Fuzzing)
1. Notice scanner service doesn't start

### Example Project

<!-- If possible, please create an example project here on GitLab.com that exhibits the problematic 
behavior, and link to it here in the bug report. If you are using an older version of GitLab, this 
will also determine whether the bug is fixed in a more recent version. -->

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

API Security job fails waiting for scanner to become available.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

API Security job is able to start a session with the scanner.

### Possible fixes

1. [x] Rename the environment variable to `API_SECURITY_DEV_DB_TYPE`
1. [x] Release new container
1. [x] Add to troubleshooting guide with version guidance

title: Geo secondary proxying: replication lag can introduce read-after-write inconsistencies
description:
When running a full QA pipeline on a GET setup with Geo proxying enabled, we can see a few tests failing as they are relying on read-your-writes consistency:

```
qa/specs/features/ee/browser_ui/3_create/repository/push_rules_spec.rb:162
qa/specs/features/browser_ui/3_create/repository/protocol_v2_push_ssh_spec.rb:30
qa/specs/features/ee/browser_ui/3_create/repository/file_locking_spec.rb:46
qa/specs/features/ee/browser_ui/3_create/repository/file_locking_spec.rb:35
qa/specs/features/api/3_create/merge_request/push_options_mwps_spec.rb:75
qa/specs/features/browser_ui/1_manage/user/follow_user_activity_spec.rb:64
qa/specs/features/browser_ui/6_release/pages/pages_pipeline_spec.rb:34
qa/specs/features/browser_ui/3_create/merge_request/merge_merge_request_from_fork_spec.rb:20
qa/specs/features/browser_ui/7_configure/auto_devops/create_project_with_auto_devops_spec.rb:116
qa/specs/features/browser_ui/3_create/snippet/clone_push_pull_personal_snippet_spec.rb:73
qa/specs/features/browser_ui/3_create/snippet/clone_push_pull_project_snippet_spec.rb:74
qa/specs/features/browser_ui/3_create/merge_request/rebase_merge_request_spec.rb:12
qa/specs/features/browser_ui/3_create/merge_request/suggestions/batch_suggestion_spec.rb:49
qa/specs/features/api/3_create/repository/push_postreceive_idempotent_spec.rb:20
qa/specs/features/browser_ui/3_create/merge_request/cherry_pick/cherry_pick_a_merge_spec.rb:25
```

Here's a flow that explains what happens, through the QA test:

```
D, [2021-11-09T15:33:13.255293 #2083224] DEBUG -- : Git: pwd=[/tmp/d20211109-2083224-tyhpwd], command=[HOME="/tmp/qa-netrc-credentials/2083224" git clone  http://root@unified.geo-gitlab-test.ml/gitlab-qa-sandbox-group/group_for_follow_user_activity_f3d2c6e495c0821d/project-for-tags-92bebaf335c7d849.git ./ 2>&1]
D, [2021-11-09T15:33:13.635379 #2083224] DEBUG -- : Git: output=[Cloning into '.'...]
D, [2021-11-09T15:33:13.656420 #2083224] DEBUG -- : Git: pwd=[/tmp/d20211109-2083224-tyhpwd], command=[HOME="/tmp/qa-netrc-credentials/2083224" git commit -m "This is a test commit" 2>&1]
D, [2021-11-09T15:33:13.667557 #2083224] DEBUG -- : Git: pwd=[/tmp/d20211109-2083224-tyhpwd], command=[HOME="/tmp/qa-netrc-credentials/2083224" git push http://root@unified.geo-gitlab-test.ml/gitlab-qa-sandbox-group/group_for_follow_user_activity_f3d2c6e495c0821d/project-for-tags-92bebaf335c7d849.git main:main 2>&1]
D, [2021-11-09T15:33:15.050080 #2083224] DEBUG -- : Git: output=[warning: redirecting to http://unified.geo-gitlab-test.ml/-/push_from_secondary/2/gitlab-qa-sandbox-group/group_for_follow_user_activity_f3d2c6e495c0821d/project-for-tags-92bebaf335c7d849.git/
remote:
remote: This request to a Geo secondary node will be forwarded to the
remote: Geo primary node:
remote:
remote:   http://unified.geo-gitlab-test.ml/gitlab-qa-sandbox-group/group_for_follow_user_activity_f3d2c6e495c0821d/project-for-tags-92bebaf335c7d849.git
remote:
remote:
To http://unified.geo-gitlab-test.ml/gitlab-qa-sandbox-group/group_for_follow_user_activity_f3d2c6e495c0821d/project-for-tags-92bebaf335c7d849.git
 * [new branch]      main -> main], exitstatus=[0]
D, [2021-11-09T15:33:15.586182 #2083224] DEBUG -- : Git: pwd=[/tmp/d20211109-2083224-oj34bs], command=[HOME="/tmp/qa-netrc-credentials/2083224" git clone  http://root@unified.geo-gitlab-test.ml/gitlab-qa-sandbox-group/group_for_follow_user_activity_f3d2c6e495c0821d/project-for-tags-92bebaf335c7d849.git ./ 2>&1]
D, [2021-11-09T15:33:15.909454 #2083224] DEBUG -- : Git: output=[Cloning into '.'...
warning: You appear to have cloned an empty repository.], exitstatus=[0]
D, [2021-11-09T15:33:15.937943 #2083224] DEBUG -- : Git: pwd=[/tmp/d20211109-2083224-oj34bs], command=[HOME="/tmp/qa-netrc-credentials/2083224" git checkout  "main" 2>&1]
D, [2021-11-09T15:33:15.951788 #2083224] DEBUG -- : Git: output=[error: pathspec 'main' did not match any file(s) known to git], exitstatus=[1]
```

Thus:

1. Clone from the secondary => repository wasn't replicated yet, gets redirected to the primary, pulls the empty repo
1. Push to the secondary => gets proxied to the primary, as secondary isn't writable
1. Clone again from the secondary => the push wasn't replicated yet, resulting in the clone of the stale, empty repo

This seems to be a problem with even a tiny amount of replication lag, as in - any replication lag greater than the delay between the write -> read, as the secondary isn't aware of this delay in the first place.

## Proposal

- [ ] Add `project_repository_last_updated_at` (Naming is debatable but I think it should be at least different from `last_repository_updated_at`) to `project_repository_states`
- [ ] Add `wiki_repository_last_updated_at` also since we're already doing a migration to this table
- [ ] Add code to touch these when a project/wiki repository is updated
- [ ] Modify `ProjectRegistry#repository_out_of_date?` to check the new field also, if it is set
- [ ] If DB replication lag < small_db_lag, then sleep DB replication lag seconds in `repository_out_of_date?` right before checking `project_repository_last_updated_at`
- [ ] Hard code small_db_lag at least for now, maybe 250ms

Leave `last_repository_updated_at` alone for now.

title: Validate `default_branch_image` on the container-scanning analyzer
description:
<!--
Implementation issues are used break-up a large piece of work into small, discrete tasks that can
move independently through the build workflow steps. They're typically used to populate a Feature
Epic. Once created, an implementation issue is usually refined in order to populate and review the
implementation plan and weight.
Example workflow: https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/development/threat-management/planning/diagram.html#plan
-->

## Why are we doing this work
<!--
A brief explanation of the why, not the what or how. Assume the reader doesn't know the
background and won't have time to dig-up information from comment threads.
-->

Follow-up for https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/container-scanning/-/merge_requests/2610

Since `default_branch_image` is a user-provided value and also is validated by the `security-report-schemas`, we should add validation to `container-scanning` to make sure that the provided value is valid. If it is not, then we should emit an error and exit. This will prevent `container-scanning` from being able to produce artifacts which are invalid according to the schema.


## Relevant links
<!--
Information that the developer might need to refer to when implementing the issue.

- [Design Issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/<id>)
  - [Design 1](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/<id>/designs/<image>.png)
  - [Design 2](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/<id>/designs/<image>.png)
- [Similar implementation](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/<id>)
-->


## Non-functional requirements
<!--
Add details for required items and delete others.
-->

- [ ] Documentation:
- [ ] Feature flag:
- [ ] Performance:
- [ ] Testing:


## Implementation plan

- [x] ~backend Add a regex to validate the `default_branch_image`. https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/339078 tries to solve a similar case, maybe we can use the same regex
- [x] ~backend Validate the `default_branch_image` and log error in [`Gcs::Vulnerability#update_location_image_and_os`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/container-scanning/-/blob/ddf2f7abc69527fd0509831c7e75b1b011c523de/lib/gcs/vulnerability.rb#L75-87) if the validation fails

e.g.:

  - [ ] `@person` Step 1a

-->

title: [Feature flag] Rollout of `multiple_gpg_signatures`
description:
<!-- Title suggestion: [Feature flag] Enable description of feature -->

## Summary

This issue is to rollout [the feature](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/74095) on production,
that is currently behind the `multiple_gpg_signatures` feature flag.

<!-- Short description of what the feature is about and link to relevant other issues. -->

## Owners

* Team: ~"group::source code"
* Most appropriate slack channel to reach out to: `#g_create_source-code-be`
* Best individual to reach out to: @vyaklushin

## Stakeholders

<!--
Are there any other stages or teams involved that need to be kept in the loop?

- Name of a PM
- The Support Team
- The Delivery Team
-->

## Expectations

### What are we expecting to happen?

Commits with multiple PGP signatures will be marked as Unverified.

<!-- Describe the expected outcome when rolling out this feature -->

### What might happen if this goes wrong?

PGP signatures don't set correctly or missing

### What can we monitor to detect problems with this?

<!-- Which dashboards from https://dashboards.gitlab.net are most relevant? -->

## Rollout Steps

### Rollout on non-production environments

- Ensure that the feature MRs have been deployed to non-production environments.
    - [x] `/chatops run auto_deploy status <merge-commit-of-your-feature>`
- [x] Enable the feature globally on non-production environments.
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set multiple_gpg_signatures true --dev`
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set multiple_gpg_signatures true --staging`
- [x] Verify that the feature works as expected. Posting the QA result in this issue is preferable.

### Specific rollout on production

- Ensure that the feature MRs have been deployed to both production and canary.
    - [x] `/chatops run auto_deploy status <merge-commit-of-your-feature>`
- If you're using [project-actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), you must enable the feature on these entries:
    - [x] `/chatops run feature set --project=gitlab-org/gitlab multiple_gpg_signatures true`
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set --project=gitlab-org/gitlab-foss multiple_gpg_signatures true`
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set --project=gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com multiple_gpg_signatures true`
- If you're using [group-actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), you must enable the feature on these entries:
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set --group=gitlab-org multiple_gpg_signatures true`
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set --group=gitlab-com multiple_gpg_signatures true`
- If you're using [user-actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), you must enable the feature on these entries:
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set --user=<your-username> multiple_gpg_signatures true`
- [x] Verify that the feature works on the specific entries. Posting the QA result in this issue is preferable.

### Preparation before global rollout

- [x] Check if the feature flag change needs to be accompanied with a
  [change management issue](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/change-management/#feature-flags-and-the-change-management-process).
  Cross link the issue here if it does.
- [x] Ensure that you or a representative in development can be available for at least 2 hours after feature flag updates in production.
  If a different developer will be covering, or an exception is needed, please inform the oncall SRE by using the `@sre-oncall` Slack alias.
- [x] Ensure that documentation has been updated ([More info](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/documentation/feature_flags.html#features-that-became-enabled-by-default)).
- [x] Announce on [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/74095) an estimated time this will be enabled on GitLab.com.
- [x] If the feature might impact the user experience, notify `#support_gitlab-com` and your team channel ([more guidance when this is necessary in the dev docs](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#communicate-the-change)).

### Global rollout on production

For visibility, all `/chatops` commands that target production should be:

- Executed in the `#production` slack channel.
- Cross-posted (with the command results) to the responsible team's slack channel (`#g_TEAM_NAME`).

- [x] [Incrementally roll out](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#process) the feature.
  - If the feature flag in code has [an actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), perform **actor-based** rollout.
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set multiple_gpg_signatures <rollout-percentage> --actors`
  - If the feature flag in code does **NOT** have [an actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), perform time-based rollout (**random** rollout).
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set multiple_gpg_signatures <rollout-percentage>`
  - Enable the feature globally on production environment.
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set multiple_gpg_signatures true`
- [x] Announce on [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/74095) that the feature has been globally enabled.
- [x] Wait for [at least one day for the verification term](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release).

### (Optional) Release the feature with the feature flag

If you're still unsure whether the feature is [deemed stable](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release)
but want to release it in the current milestone, you can change the default state of the feature flag to be enabled.
To do so, follow these steps:

- [x] Create a merge request with the following changes. Ask for review and merge it.
    - [x] Set the `default_enabled` attribute in [the feature flag definition](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-flag-definition-and-validation) to `true`.
    - [x] Create [a changelog entry](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#changelog).
- [ ] Ensure that the default-enabling MR has been deployed to both production and canary.
      If the merge request was deployed before [the code cutoff](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/releases/#self-managed-releases-1),
      the feature can be officially announced in a release blog post.
    - [ ] `/chatops run auto_deploy status <merge-commit-of-default-enabling-mr>`
- [ ] Close [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/74095) to indicate the feature will be released in the current milestone.
- [ ] Set the next milestone to this rollout issue for scheduling [the flag removal](#release-the-feature).
- [ ] (Optional) You can create a separate issue for scheduling the steps below to [Release the feature](#release-the-feature).
    - [ ] Set the title to "[Feature flag] Cleanup `multiple_gpg_signatures`".
    - [ ] Execute the `/copy_metadata <this-rollout-issue-link>` quick action to copy the labels from this rollout issue.
    - [ ] Link this rollout issue as a related issue.
    - [ ] Close this rollout issue.

**WARNING:** This approach has the downside that it makes it difficult for us to
[clean up](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up) the flag.
For example, on-premise users could disable the feature on their GitLab instance. But when you
remove the flag at some point, they suddenly see the feature as enabled and they can't roll it back
to the previous behavior. To avoid this potential breaking change, use this approach only for urgent
matters.

### Release the feature

After the feature has been [deemed stable](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release),
the [clean up](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up)
should be done as soon as possible to permanently enable the feature and reduce complexity in the
codebase.

<!-- The checklist here is to help stakeholders keep track of the feature flag status -->
- [x] Create a merge request to remove `multiple_gpg_signatures` feature flag. Ask for review and merge it.
    - [x] Remove all references to the feature flag from the codebase.
    - [x] Remove the YAML definitions for the feature from the repository.
    - [x] Create [a changelog entry](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#changelog).
- [ ] Ensure that the cleanup MR has been deployed to both production and canary.
      If the merge request was deployed before [the code cutoff](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/releases/#self-managed-releases-1),
      the feature can be officially announced in a release blog post.
    - [ ] `/chatops run auto_deploy status <merge-commit-of-cleanup-mr>`
- [ ] Close [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/74095) to indicate the feature will be released in the current milestone.
- [ ] Clean up the feature flag from all environments by running these chatops command in `#production` channel:
    - [x] `/chatops run feature delete multiple_gpg_signatures --dev`
    - [x] `/chatops run feature delete multiple_gpg_signatures --staging`
    - [x] `/chatops run feature delete multiple_gpg_signatures`
- [x] Close this rollout issue.

## Rollback Steps

- [ ] This feature can be disabled by running the following Chatops command:

```
/chatops run feature set multiple_gpg_signatures false
```

title: Migrate Status Checks: Add retry button when widget failed to load
description:
## Problem to solve

For https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/7066 we want the user to be able to retry fetching the status checks report when the widget failed to load.

## Required reading

- [Figma designs](https://www.figma.com/file/qEddyqCrI7kPSBjGmwkZzQ/Component-library?node-id=40674%3A48504)
- [Merge request reports - Pajamas](https://design.gitlab.com/regions/merge-request-reports)

## Design screenshot

![image](/uploads/bcdd6b1e02f821e31af8d23876784bd2/image.png)

## Implementation

~frontend weight :two: 

1. [x] Add a `Retry` button when the fetch fails.
1. [x] Hide the button when loading or the fetch succeeds.
1. [x] Refetch the status checks report when `Retry` is clicked.
1. [x] Add or update status checks report

    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set --group=gitlab-org <feature-flag-name> true`
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set --group=gitlab-com <feature-flag-name> true`
- If you're using [user-actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), you must enable the feature on these entries:
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set --user=<your-username> <feature-flag-name> true`
- [ ] Verify that the feature works on the specific entries. Posting the QA result in this issue is preferable.
- [x] Global rollout For Service ping thins should be rollout globally `/chatops run feature set usage_data_instrumentation true`

### Preparation before global rollout

- [ ] Check if the feature flag change needs to be accompanied with a
  [change management issue](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/change-management/#feature-flags-and-the-change-management-process).
  Cross link the issue here if it does.
- [x] Ensure that you or a representative in development can be available for at least 2 hours after feature flag updates in production.
  If a different developer will be covering, or an exception is needed, please inform the oncall SRE by using the `@sre-oncall` Slack alias.
- [ ] Ensure that documentation has been updated ([More info](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/documentation/feature_flags.html#features-that-became-enabled-by-default)).
- [ ] Announce on [the feature issue](ISSUE LINK) an estimated time this will be enabled on GitLab.com.
- [ ] If the feature might impact the user experience, notify `#support_gitlab-com` and your team channel ([more guidance when this is necessary in the dev docs](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#communicate-the-change)).

### Global rollout on production

For visibility, all `/chatops` commands that target production should be:

- Executed in the `#production` slack channel.
- Cross-posted (with the command results) to the responsible team's slack channel (`#g_product_intelligence`).

- [ ] [Incrementally roll out](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#process) the feature.
  - If the feature flag in code has [an actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), perform **actor-based** rollout.
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set <feature-flag-name> <rollout-percentage> --actors`
  - If the feature flag in code does **NOT** have [an actor](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-actors), perform time-based rollout (**random** rollout).
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set <feature-flag-name> <rollout-percentage>`
  - Enable the feature globally on production environment.
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature set <feature-flag-name> true`
- [ ] Announce on [the feature issue](ISSUE LINK) that the feature has been globally enabled.
- [ ] Wait for [at least one day for the verification term](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release).

### (Optional) Release the feature with the feature flag

If you're still unsure whether the feature is [deemed stable](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release)
but want to release it in the current milestone, you can change the default state of the feature flag to be enabled.
To do so, follow these steps:

- [ ] Create a merge request with the following changes. Ask for review and merge it.
    - [ ] Set the `default_enabled` attribute in [the feature flag definition](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#feature-flag-definition-and-validation) to `true`.
    - [ ] Create [a changelog entry](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#changelog).
- [ ] Ensure that the default-enabling MR has been deployed to both production and canary.
      If the merge request was deployed before [the code cutoff](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/releases/#self-managed-releases-1),
      the feature can be officially announced in a release blog post.
    - [ ] `/chatops run auto_deploy status <merge-commit-of-default-enabling-mr>`
- [ ] Close [the feature issue](ISSUE LINK) to indicate the feature will be released in the current milestone.
- [ ] Set the next milestone to this rollout issue for scheduling [the flag removal](#release-the-feature).
- [ ] (Optional) You can create a separate issue for scheduling the steps below to [Release the feature](#release-the-feature).
    - [ ] Set the title to "[Feature flag] Cleanup `<feature-flag-name>`".
    - [ ] Execute the `/copy_metadata <this-rollout-issue-link>` quick action to copy the labels from this rollout issue.
    - [ ] Link this rollout issue as a related issue.
    - [ ] Close this rollout issue.

**WARNING:** This approach has the downside that it makes it difficult for us to
[clean up](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up) the flag.
For example, on-premise users could disable the feature on their GitLab instance. But when you
remove the flag at some point, they suddenly see the feature as enabled and they can't roll it back
to the previous behavior. To avoid this potential breaking change, use this approach only for urgent
matters.

### Release the feature

After the feature has been [deemed stable](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release),
the [clean up](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up)
should be done as soon as possible to permanently enable the feature and reduce complexity in the
codebase.

<!-- The checklist here is to help stakeholders keep track of the feature flag status -->
- [x] Create a merge request to remove `<feature-flag-name>` feature flag. Ask for review and merge it.
    - [x] Remove all references to the feature flag from the codebase.
    - [x] Remove the YAML definitions for the feature from the repository.
    - [x] Create [a changelog entry](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#changelog).
- [x] Ensure that the cleanup MR has been deployed to both production and canary.
      If the merge request was deployed before [the code cutoff](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/releases/#self-managed-releases-1),
      the feature can be officially announced in a release blog post.
    - [x] `/chatops run auto_deploy status <merge-commit-of-cleanup-mr>`
- [x] Close [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/338029) to indicate the feature will be released in the current milestone.
- [x] Clean up the feature flag from all environments by running these chatops command in `#production` channel:
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature delete <feature-flag-name> --dev`
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature delete <feature-flag-name> --staging`
    - [ ] `/chatops run feature delete <feature-flag-name>`
- [x] Close this rollout issue.

## Rollback Steps

- [ ] This feature can be disabled by running the following Chatops command:

```
/chatops run feature set <feature-flag-name> false
```

title: Stop tracking Page Title in Snowplow
description:
With our [Pseudonymization](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/6309) work we are hashing User IDs and remove Personal Identifying information from URLs. This should also happen for the current Page Title by not submitting the data.

Example query to get the current data:

```sql
select page_title, page_url_path, page_url from legacy.snowplow_page_views_30 LIMIT 10;
```

1. As a first step, we should stop tracking `page_title`
2. We should investigate how we can delete the data on our data warehouse

### SiSense dashboards utilizing this data

A search on dashboards utilizing this data show 2 results, both dashboards were created by a team member which is no longer working with GitLab.

Reference: https://gitlab.com/search?search=page_title&group_id=4347861&project_id=11096787&snippets=false&repository_ref=

title: Unify loading Monaco
description:
At the moment we have two ways of loading Monaco:

  - the modern one, where we explicitly import `monaco` in the modules requiring it, and
  - the legacy one where some modules assume `monaco` to be a global object living in the global namespace.

The second approach was the default one previously. After [upgrading Moanco](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/63400) in %"14.1" the default way of adding Monaco is to explicitly import it where needed. During the upgrade, to support the existing use cases, we have introduced the `globalAPI: true` [option for the MonacoWebpackPlugin](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/config/webpack.config.js#L457) which does put monaco in the global namespace as well.

So, technically, now we can face (and it seems like we do face) the conflicts when two versions of Monaco are available at the same time (one explicitly imported and another one from the global namespace) which might lead to all sorts of potential conflicts and race conditions.

This issue aims at solving the problem by:

  - switching all use cases to explicitly import `monaco`
  - remove the `globalAPI: true` "hack" from the webpack configuration

title: Add hint about short expiries on token to group import
description:
### Problem

As mentioned in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/manage/import/backend/discussion/-/issues/9#note_727309376, we should be adding adding tooltips / informative messages to the Group Import page to suggest that users set short expiries on tokens they create for Import. This is in line with https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/security/token_overview.html#security-considerations and a recent update update from https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/73696.

### Proposal

Let's add a hint to our UI:

| Option A (icon tooltip) | Option B (extra sentence) |
| ------ | ------ |
| ![Bildschirmfoto_2021-11-09_um_09.37.38](/uploads/0d78345c409a25ca9e61a6de06db933e/Bildschirmfoto_2021-11-09_um_09.37.38.png) | ![image](/uploads/1ca0a2cc22cc192e69e3a2d92d8eab63/image.png) |
| This consumes less spaces but if we need to add a link along with the message, this is not ideal on hover.  | This adds more text to the UI but it seems to be consistent with the existing hint/text we're already showing. Also, this allows us to link to the our docs for further reading. |

title: Migrate to .NET 6
description:
### Problem

API Security uses the long term support (LTS) version of .NET. The current TLS version, .NET Core 3.1, will go out of support in Dec 2022. API Security must migrate to the new LTS version prior to then.

Additionally, the new .NET 6 LTS release has a number of improvements around performance and I/O that are useful for API Security.

### Proposal

- Based on the guide [Migrate from 3.1 to 6 LTS](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/migration/31-to-60?view=aspnetcore-6.0&tabs=visual-studio), perform a simple update of SDK/Runtime.
    - Update SDK
    - Update Targets
    - Update package reference
    - Update docker images

Links:

- [.NET 6](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/announcing-net-6/)
- [Migrate from 3.1 to 6 LTS](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/migration/31-to-60?view=aspnetcore-6.0&tabs=visual-studio)
- [Migrate from 3.1 to 5](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/migration/31-to-50?view=aspnetcore-6.0&tabs=visual-studio)
- [Migrate from 5 to 6](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/migration/50-to-60?view=aspnetcore-6.0&tabs=visual-studio)

title: Document pseudonymization of gitlab_standard context on Snowplow Guide
description:
Like #340106 (URLs), we need to add more details of the newly implemented pseudonymized properties on the `gitlab_standard` schema. Included in all Snowplow events.

### Success criteria

- On the [implementation section](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/snowplow/implementation.html), mention that frontend events append the context at `window.gl.snowplowStandardContext` with default data set at [app/views/layouts/_snowplow.html.haml#L13-14](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/views/layouts/_snowplow.html.haml#L13-14).
- Update the [schemas section](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/snowplow/schemas.html), and mention what properties are automatically set.
- Update the [Snowplow request flow](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/snowplow/#snowplow-request-flow)
- Add more information about the usage of [`data-track-context`](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/snowplow/implementation.html#data-track-attributes).
- Mention how to set custom values (or how to override) for these properties. Although not recommending it.
- Add a [Merge Request Template](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/description_templates.html#create-a-merge-request-template) to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/iglu to describe how added fields to the context need to get updated in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/growth/product-intelligence/snowplow-pseudonymization (Completed at https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/iglu/-/merge_requests/74)
- Adjust dangerbot to suggest MR template for gitlab standard context changes

description:
![image](/uploads/6ebc2c2e5ecb16dbafab4436ed114418/image.png)

From https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/344836:0


> It seems that when there was an API error, we used our internal `reportError` method which set the app status to `ERROR`. It seems that doing so causes an infinite loop in the query. I am still unsure *why* that specific call created the infinite loop :thinking: Because we were only using the `ERROR` status at one place, I removed it entirely and used a different approach for the component that needed to know about that error. Now the app doesn't freeze anymore and show the error at the top:

title: Dependency Scanning fails when NuGet packages.lock.json contains ProjectReference nodes
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "type::bug" label:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=regression
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=type::bug

and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

Dependency Scanning job fails to scan a NuGet `packages.lock.json` when:
- It has nodes where the `type` is `"Project"` (project references).
- A project node is referenced in the `dependencies` of another project node.
- The names don't match because the case isn't the case.

In this case the analyzer fails with a `cannot find nuget dependency` error, because the project node referenced in `dependencies` has no match.

Example:

```json
{
  "version": 1,
  "dependencies": {
    ".NETCoreApp,Version=v5.0": {
      "dep1": {
        "type": "Project",
        "dependencies": {
          "Dep2": "1.0.0"
        }
      },
      "dep2": {
        "type": "Project"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

### Further details

Right now the [file parser](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium/-/blob/v2.29.11/scanner/parser/nuget/nuget.go#L29) assumes that a `packages.lock.json` is made of `Direct` nodes or `Transitive` nodes. `Project` nodes are handled like `Transitive` nodes.

`packages.lock.json` defines 4 dependency types: `Direct`, `Transitive`, `Project`, and `CentralTransitive`.

Links:

- https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/6.2.0.80/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.ProjectModel/ProjectLockFile/PackageDependencyType.cs#L21
- https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/6.2.0.80/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.ProjectModel/ProjectLockFile/LockFileDependency.cs#L23
- https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/6.2.0.80/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.ProjectModel/ProjectLockFile/PackagesLockFileFormat.cs#L220

### Example project

https://gitlab.com/kriwaaga-public/gitlab/gemnasium-dotnet-projectreference-bug/-/jobs/1769022564#L28

### Steps to reproduce

Create a .NET project with a generated `packages.lock.json` file that contains references to other projects, and where the case is different.

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

The `gemnasium-dependency_scanning` job fails:

```
$ /analyzer run
[INFO] [Gemnasium] [2021-10-21T14:35:51Z]  GitLab Gemnasium analyzer v2.29.9
[INFO] [Gemnasium] [2021-10-21T14:35:53Z]  Using commit xxxxx
 of vulnerability database
[FATA] [Gemnasium] [2021-10-21T14:35:53Z]  cannot find nuget dependency: Example.Project.A
```

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Scanning job doesn't fail.

### Possible fixes

- Change the NuGet [lock file parser](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium/-/blob/v2.29.11/scanner/parser/nuget/nuget.go#L29) to exclude `ProjectReference` entries, that is entries where the `type` is `Project`.
- Don't skip `Project` nodes, but make ignore the case when resolving their `dependencies`.

### Implementation plan

- [x] Change the [NuGet lock file parser](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium/-/blob/v2.29.11/scanner/parser/nuget/nuget.go#L29)
   - Process `Project` nodes as direct dependencies.
   - Ignore case when resolving package names.
   - Cover this in parser unit tests.
- [x] Release new version.

title: Replace confirm danger modal in transfer project form
description:
As part of our effort to [replace bootstrap modals](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/254274), we should replace the existing [haml confirm_modal](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/views/shared/_confirm_modal.html.haml) with a vue component, utilising GlModal.

This issue replaces the [remaining usages](https://gitlab.com/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&search=js-confirm-danger&group_id=9970&project_id=278964&scope=&search_code=true&snippets=false&repository_ref=master&nav_source=navbar) of the confirm_modal, with our new vuejs modal introduced in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/342115.

Given the modal is used in some fairly sensitive parts of the codebase, it makes sense to migrate each instance in separate MRs, this should hopefully reduce any possible negative impacts.

Related to #342116.

title: CI/CD Analytics: Deprecate and remove unnecessary metric
description:
## Problem to solve

For CI/CD Analytics we introduced [metrics by tab](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/342926), which makes the total metric unnecessary (because that's the sum of the metrics by tab).

## Proposal

After the [3 new metrics have been introduced](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/342926), and we are confident they are working as expected, we should deprecate and remove the existing page-level usage metric called `p_analytics_pipelines_monthly`:

- Replace usage in Sisense.
- Confirm with ~"group::product intelligence" that the metric is not being used in Sisense (see [example](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/344100#note_722494132)).
- Announce deprecation? (is there a process for this?)
- Remove from codebase.

Note: This was extracted from https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/342926 as [suggested by @blabuschagne](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/342926#note_724827702).

title: Add the ability to publish and install Conan packages with only name/version
description:
*This page may contain information related to upcoming products, features and functionality. It is important to note that the information presented is for informational purposes only, so please do not rely on the information for purchasing or planning purposes. Just like with all projects, the items mentioned on the page are subject to change or delay, and the development, release, and timing of any products, features, or functionality remain at the sole discretion of GitLab Inc.*

### Context

When you publish a Conan package, you can simply use the `package-name/version` or the full recipe: `package-name/version@user/channel`. Based on our interactions with the Conan community, it seems it is much more common for C/C++ developers to use only the package name and version when publishing Conan packages.

### Problem to solve

The problem is that GitLab only accepts the full recipe. This means that C/C++ developers need to customize their package naming conventions just to use GitLab. For many of our customers, this is a deal-breaker.

### Proposal

Allow developers to publish Conan packages with name/version only, which is the more commonly used convention. This change will only impact those using the project-level endpoint, as the instance-level packages rely on the `user` in `pkg/version@user/channel` to identify the target project

#### Further details

Check out the result of the technical investigation for further details. https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/345054#results-of-the-investigation

title: Implementation issue - Create bridge/trigger job show page
description:
*The following page may contain information related to upcoming products, features and functionality. It is important to note that the information presented is for informational purposes only, so please do not rely on the information for purchasing or planning purposes. Just like with all projects, the items mentioned on the page are subject to change or delay, and the development, release, and timing of any products, features, or functionality remain at the sole discretion of GitLab Inc.*

### Release notes

Today it's possible to retry the failed jobs in a downstream pipeline by going into the downstream pipeline and hitting the "Retry" button from there. However this user experience does NOT provide a solution in case users would like downstream pipelines to pick up a new pipeline code. Resubmitting the whole parent pipeline from the MR is possible, but it also reruns all the other pipelines, not only the one affected one.

## Goal

The goal here is to show the trigger job page without the logs. This behavior would resemble how we currently show the manual jobs before they are executed.

### Outcome

- A trigger job page with an empty state instead of the logs and a link to the downstream pipeline that the job triggered. The downstream pipeline should open in the same tab, but user should be able to right-click on the button and open the downstream pipeline page in a new tab if they wish.
- The "Retry" button should retry the trigger job and update the job status to running.

:link: [Trigger job illustration](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-svgs/blob/main/illustrations/job-trigger-md.svg)

title: Automated CS demo cluster creation
description:
Follow-up of https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/344483 and [this Slack thread](https://gitlab.slack.com/archives/CR5JLJEEM/p1634002316428100) (as long as it hasn't vanished from storage yet).

## Current State

Assembling Kubernetes clusters that can be used to demo Container Security features is currently:

* a manual, complex task
* hence error-prone
* (under)documented across multiple locations
* siloed knowledge

## Desired State

Instead, assembling such demo clusters should be:

* automated
* repeatable
* documented
* accessible to a large audience -- not just engineers in the know
* continuously tested

A solution must enable at least:

* Creation of a GKE cluster
* Integration of the cluster with an existing external GitLab instance
  * GitLab Agent installed within the cluster and registered to instance
* ~~Threat Monitoring dashboard~~
  * ~~Cilium configured as cluster network plugin~~
  * ~~Cilium's Hubble Prometheus exporter exposed~~
  * ~~Prometheus installed and scraping Hubble~~
* Continuous Testing
  * We want to stand up and tear down demo clusters periodically

## Implementation Plan

Codify the creation of Container Security demo clusters so that they become available with low effort. We probably want to use some IaC tool to implement this.

For example there's a GitLab provider and a 

# Implementation Plan

* We bundle the [existing installation script](https://gitlab.com/bwill/network-alerts-quick-start/-/blob/e8701c68be83f560ecca25c87b3f0742e647930e/install.sh) as an image which includes the utilities we need (gcloud, kubectl, helm, etc).

* We create documentation on (1) how to use the script, ie. required parameters, (2) the effects of the script, ie. what it does on behalf of the user.

* Question is if we want to create the cluster on behalf of the user too, or if we assume people bring their own, and we only provision it.

* If we want to create the cluster, we can do so as follows:

    ```
    gcloud container clusters create $NAME --region $REGION
    gcloud container clusters get-credentials $NAME --region $REGION
    ```

    We need to prompt the user for cluster name and region, or accept additional flags.

* ~~Currently, the script attempts to install Cilium from a helmfile.yaml. Either we need to supply it, or create a [Cilium Helm release for GKE](https://docs.cilium.io/en/v1.9/gettingstarted/k8s-install-gke/) with helm directly.~~

## CI

* General idea is to run the script and feed it parameters that don't clash across branches. For example, the name of the cluster to create would include a commit hash, branch name, etc.
* In a mandatory teardown step, we always destroy the created cluster.
* To authenticate to GCP, we create a GCP Service Account with narrowed-down permissions and store it in a CI variable. We authenticate gcloud(1) with it.

title: [Feature flag] Orders harmonization rollout
description:
<!-- Title suggestion: [Feature flag] Enable description of feature -->

## Summary

This issue is to rollout [Zuora Orders Harmonization](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/6641#callout-configuration-changes) on CustomersDot production,
that is currently behind the [`orders_harmonization`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/customers-gitlab-com/-/feature_flags/104/edit) feature flag.  The feature flag was originally introduced in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/customers-gitlab-com/-/issues/3557.

Related Enterprise Apps issue: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/business-technology/enterprise-apps/intake/-/issues/616

### Context

When the Orders Harmonization (aka OH) feature is enabled in Zuora, Zuora Orders API can be used to make changes to subscriptions (create new ones, add seats, upgrade plan, etc).  This will be the preferred method for making these changes instead of using the existing Subscribe or Amend Zuora APIs which CustomersDot utilizes currently.  However, with OH enabled, the Subscribe and Amend APIs are still available for use, but they also generate an equivalent Order.  Sales-assisted purchases will use Orders once this is available.

When an Order is processed, Zuora will trigger the `Order Processed` callout (because we will have this enabled in our Zuora instance).  If the Subscribe or Amend API is used when OH is enabled, the `Amendment Processed` or `New Subscription Created` callout will still be called.  The `Order Processed` callout will only be processed when the `orders_harmonization` feature flag is enabled.

## Owners

- Team: ~"group::provision" 
- Most appropriate slack channel to reach out to: `#g_provision`
- Best individual to reach out to: @jameslopez @a_luna @tyleramos 
- PM: @courtmeddaugh

## Stakeholders

- @gitlab-com/business-technology/enterprise-apps/zuora-architects

## Expectations

### What are we expecting to happen?

When the `orders_harmonization` flag is enabled, the `Order Processed` callout will be processed by the `ZuoraCallout::OrderProcessedWorker` in CustomersDot if the Zuora Orders API is used.

### What might happen if this goes wrong?

We might see some provisioning events missed for subscription updates.  If this happens, we could provision the missed subscription updates manually.  Notify the owners mentioned above if this is observed.

### What can we monitor to detect problems with this?

- [Check Sentry](https://sentry.gitlab.net/gitlab/customersgitlabcom/) for any errors that look related to processing callouts.
- View the `log/sidekiq.log` on the server to view any processed callout workers.

## Rollout Steps

### Rollout on non-production environments

- [x] Ensure that the feature MRs have been deployed to non-production environments.
    - [x] https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/customers-gitlab-com/-/issues/3569
- [x] Consider announcing that Orders Harmonization will be enabled in Zuora to potentially impacted groups, e.g. `#s_fulfillment_engineering`
- [x] Get confirmation from @jesssalcido that Orders Harmonization is enabled in Zuora Central Sandbox (test.zuora.com).
  - [x] Ensure that @jesssalcido has configured the `Order Processed` callout similar to Zuora API Sandbox.
- [x] Consider announcing that the flag will be enabled to potentially impacted groups, e.g. `#s_fulfillment_engineering`
- [x] Enable the feature globally on non-production environments.
    - [x] Navigate to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/customers-gitlab-com/-/feature_flags/104/edit and add `customers-staging` to list of environments.
- [x] Verify that the feature works as expected. Posting the QA result in this issue.
  - Fulfillment plans on performing thorough testing and verification as part of https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/6606.

### Preparation before global rollout

- [x] Ensure that the feature MRs have been deployed to production
    - [x] https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/customers-gitlab-com/-/issues/3569
- [x] Check if the feature flag change needs to be accompanied with a
  [change management issue](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/change-management/#feature-flags-and-the-change-management-process).
  Cross link the issue here if it does.
- [x] Ensure that you or a representative in Fulfillment can be available for at least 2 hours after feature flag updates in production.
  If a different developer will be covering, or an exception is needed, please inform the oncall SRE by using the `@sre-oncall` Slack alias.
- [x] Ensure that documentation has been updated ([More info](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/documentation/feature_flags.html#features-that-became-enabled-by-default)).
- [x] Announce on [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/6641) an estimated time this will be enabled on customers.gitlab.com.
- [x] If the feature might impact the user experience, notify `#s_fulfillment` and potentially `#support_gitlab-com`, as well as your team channel ([more guidance when this is necessary in the dev docs](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#communicate-the-change)).

### Global rollout on production

- [x] Confirm the feature flag is enabled on `staging` without incident
- [x] @tyleramos - 2022-05-19 - Announce in advance that Orders Harmonization will be enabled in Zuora to potentially impacted groups, e.g. `#s_fulfillment_engineering`, `#s_fulfillment`
- [x] @tyleramos - 2022-05-20 - Create a ~"production::blocker" issue to prevent deploys to production during the maintenance window.
- [x] @tyleramos - 2022-05-20 - Upon announcement from ~"Enterprise Applications" that Orders will be enabled in our Zuora production tenant, toggle `maintenance_mode` in CDot at https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/customers-gitlab-com/-/feature_flags/111/edit.
  - [x] Test the maintenance page is working by visiting CDot production site
- [x] @tyleramos - 2022-05-20 - Quiet Sidekiq process from [Sidekiq Admin UI](https://customers.gitlab.com/sidekiq/busy)
   - This will prevent Sidekiq from processing new queued jobs but jobs will continue to enqueue.
- [x] @tyleramos - 2022-05-20 - [Engage the CMOC](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/incident-management/#how-to-engage-the-cmoc) to update status.gitlab.com
- [x] @tyleramos - 2022-05-20 - Get confirmation from @jesssalcido that Orders Harmonization is enabled in Zuora Production (zuora.com).
  - [x] Ensure that @jesssalcido has configured the `Order Processed` callout similar to Zuora API Sandbox and Central Sandbox.
- [x] @tyleramos - 2022-05-20 - Announce that the flag will be enabled to potentially impacted groups, e.g. `#s_fulfillment_engineering`, `#s_fulfillment`
- [x] @tyleramos - 2022-05-20 - Enable the feature globally on production environment 
  - [x] Navigate to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/customers-gitlab-com/-/feature_flags/104/edit and add `customers-production` to list of environments.
- [x] @tyleramos - 2022-05-20 - Announce on [the feature issue](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/6641) that the feature has been globally enabled.
- [x] @tyleramos - 2022-05-20 - Confirm with ~"Enterprise Applications" that it is safe to remove maintenance mode.
- [x] @tyleramos - 2022-05-20 - Remove maintenance mode in CustomersDot at https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/customers-gitlab-com/-/feature_flags/111/edit
   - [x] Test the maintenance page is gone
- [x] @tyleramos - 2022-05-20 - Manually restart Sidekiq
   - Connect to CDot production server and run `sudo service sidekiq restart` as [documented here](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/customers-gitlab-com#deployments)
- [x] @tyleramos - 2022-05-20 - [Engage the CMOC](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/incident-management/#how-to-engage-the-cmoc) to update status.gitlab.com
- [x] @tyleramos - 2022-05-20 - Close the ~"production::blocker" issue to resume deploys to production.
- [x] Wait for [at least one day for the verification term](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release).

### Release the feature

After the feature has been [deemed stable](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release),
the [clean up](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up)
should be done as soon as possible to permanently enable the feature and reduce complexity in the
codebase.

<!-- The checklist here is to help stakeholders keep track of the feature flag status -->
- [x] Create a merge request to remove `orders_harmonization` feature flag: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/customers-gitlab-com/-/issues/4348
  - [x] Remove all references to the feature flag from the codebase
- [x] Ensure that the cleanup MR has been deployed to both staging and production
- [x] Disable the feature flag via the [CustomersDot dashboard](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/customers-gitlab-com/-/feature_flags)
  - https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/customers-gitlab-com/-/feature_flags/104/edit
- [x] Ensure production environment is still working as expected
- [x] Remove the Unleash feature flag from the [CustomersDot dashboard](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/customers-gitlab-com/-/feature_flags)
- [x] Close this rollout issue.

## Rollback Steps

Rolling this feature back will not be possible in reality because it's dependent on the Orders Harmonization feature in Zuora.  Once Orders Harmonization is enabled in Zuora, it cannot be undone.  If the feature is enabled in Zuora, then the feature flag in CustomersDot must be enabled.  The best way forward will be to fix bugs as they arise, rather than rolling back.

title: ActionView::Template::Error (bad password component) error with non-encoded elasticsearch passwords
description:
### Summary

When [enabling Advanced Search](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/integration/elasticsearch.html#enable-advanced-search) with a password or username that contains characters that are invalid for [the User Information section of the URI](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3986#section-3.2.1) section - trying to visit the `/admin/application_settings/advanced_search` page will result in a `500` error viewing the settings - with either a:

```
URI::InvalidComponentError (bad component(expected userinfo component or user component)
```

or more likely, given the password is going to have a URI-invalid character: 

```
URI::InvalidComponentError (bad password component)
```

The error may also manifest as:

```
ActionView::Template::Error (bad password component)
```

### Steps to reproduce

1. [Enable Advanced Search](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/integration/elasticsearch.html#enable-advanced-search)
2. Enter a username or password with invalid characters for a URI - e.g. (`#1234#`)
3. `500` error when viewing the settings

Backtrace:

```
 "exception.class": "ActionView::Template::Error",
  "exception.message": "bad password component",
  "exception.backtrace": [
    "ee/app/models/ee/application_setting.rb:319:in `block in elasticsearch_url_with_credentials'",
    "ee/app/models/ee/application_setting.rb:315:in `map'",
    "ee/app/models/ee/application_setting.rb:315:in `elasticsearch_url_with_credentials'",
    "ee/app/models/ee/application_setting.rb:326:in `elasticsearch_config'",
[...]
```


### Possible fixes

The elasticsearch_username/elasticsearch_password strings likely need to be URI encoded with `URI.encode_www_form_component` when setting `URI.user` and `URI.password` when building the [elasticsearch_url_with_credentials](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/v14.4.1-ee/ee/app/models/ee/application_setting.rb#L318)


### Workaround

To get back into the settings - the password and/or username can be cleared out using the [GitLab Rails Console](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/administration/operations/rails_console.html) by running:

```
ApplicationSetting.last.update(elasticsearch_password: nil)
ApplicationSetting.last.update(elasticsearch_username: nil)
```

Alternatively - you can encode the current value(s) by doing:

```
ApplicationSetting.last.update(elasticsearch_password: URI.encode_www_form_component(ApplicationSetting.last.elasticsearch_password))
ApplicationSetting.last.update(elasticsearch_username: URI.encode_www_form_component(ApplicationSetting.last.elasticsearch_username))
```


### Release Notes

This will be added to the Bug Release Post in 14.6 

CC: @changzhengliu

title: Design: Add `include:` file links to the pipeline editor
description:
This is a frontend issue for the original proposal based of the original epic

##  Problem

Complex CI/CD configuration can contain multiple pipelines added to the main config using the `include` keyword. When editing or troubleshooting your config it's difficult to navigate between the `.gitlab-ci-yml` and the included files.

Additionally, a complex pipeline configuration might contain separate files for downstream pipelines and other files.

Engineers who author pipelines would like to edit all of their pipelines files in one place and take advantage of the pipeline editor features like pipeline visualization, linting, etc.

## :art: Proposal

As an MVC, we will surface a list of links to the pipeline files added to the config with the `include:` keyword.

Feature acceptance criteria:

* A collapsible files section will contain a list of the includes which will open in a new tab (the file will open in file view in the repo).
* The `.gitlab-ci.yml` would be highlighted as the currently open file (it won't be clickable as it's already open in the pipeline editor).
* The other pipeline files will show an external link icon on hover.
* The file names should be truncated after a certain number of characters, like we do in the [MRs file tree.](https://share.getcloudapp.com/NQu7J4v4) When a file name is truncated, we should show the full file name in a system tooltip on hover (same behavior as in the MRs file tree).
* When the list of files is long, it should be scrollable.
* The file tree will open using the "file tree" icon button placed above the file tree.
* When we release the feature, the file tree section will be expanded by default. We should remember the user's selection once they collapse the file tree, so if they collapse it, next time they open the editor it'll be collapsed.
* When project has a simple one-file pipeline, we'll show a notification inside the files section explaining that pipeline files will appear here.
* When project doesn't have a pipeline file yet (for example, when you haven't committed the `.gitlab-ci.yml` yet), we won't show the file tree section and the file tree button. We will show the button and the file tree once you commit the file.

#### Mock-up

![File_tree_MVC_design](/uploads/0b9db84f69a94ebfb06ea3712a8e0a3d/File_tree_MVC_design.png)

<!-- triage-serverless v3 PLEASE DO NOT REMOVE THIS SECTION -->
*This page may contain information related to upcoming products, features and functionality.
It is important to note that the information presented is for informational purposes only, so please do not rely on the information for purchasing or planning purposes.
Just like with all projects, the items mentioned on the page are subject to change or delay, and the development, release, and timing of any products, features, or functionality remain at the sole discretion of GitLab Inc.*
<!-- triage-serverless v3 PLEASE DO NOT REMOVE THIS SECTION -->

#### [Full proposal in the design issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/339469)

title: Backend: Expose includes links
description:
This is a backend issue to expose the list of files that are included in the main pipeline only.

Following the conversation in https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/7064#note_723983476 files that are been included in a downstream pipeline (include with include) is out of scope for this issue.

## Implementation

The breakdown for this feature is as follows:

| Work Type | Description | Issue Link |
| ------ | ------ |  ------ |
| ~backend | **Expose includes link (initial MVC)** |  :point_left: You are here |
| ~frontend  | Change the pipeline editor fixed layout to full-width | https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/346331 |
| ~frontend  | Introduce the feature flag and the empty drawer. | https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/350721 |
| ~frontend  | Pass down the content to the drawer and format it properly | https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/350722 |
| ~frontend  | Remember the open/closed state in local storage | https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/350723 |
| ~frontend | Add feature discovery popover | https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/360111 |
| ~frontend  | Roll out feature flag | https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/357219 |
| ~backend | Backend: Add toggle flag to UserCalloutFeatureNameEnum to allow for popover dismissal | https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/365347 | 
| ~frontend | Store the pipeline editor popovers state in the database | https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/360635 |
| ~backend | Add messaging when files can't be fetched due to invalid CI configuration | https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/360431 |

## Solution for this issue
Include of the main pipeline - this should be an MVC

```yaml

## .gitlab-ci.yml

include: layer1.yml
```

We should expose layer1.yml file

1. Expose all types of includes (i.e. local, remote and templates)
1. Expose include with wildcard

Include of includes:

```yaml
# layer1.yml

include: layer2.yml
```

3. Expose layer2.yml? and beyond (e.g. layer3,4...)

title: Jira Connect handle installation updates
description:
According to this [Atlassian developer community post](https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/lifecycle-events-in-case-of-site-rename-and-major-changes/48446) Jira Connect install events can also serve as an update. For example if a user changes the site URL, GitLab will receive an installed event containing a new `baseUrl`.

## Current behavior

Jira [lifecycle events](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/connect-app-descriptor/#lifecycle) are used to create or destroy `JiraConnectInstallation`s. But we also receive `installed` events when an installation already exists. Currently, we just ignore those events ([`app/controllers/jira_connect/events_controller.rb:10`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/75dc51f08f57ca41c7d0fe14f1cb8a9c59d6d24e/app/controllers/jira_connect/events_controller.rb#L10)). 

## Expected behavior

The existing installation should be updated with the contents of the [event parameters](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/487099b175c24046d5f624f3e92f02ae8033bb32/app/controllers/jira_connect/events_controller.rb#L37).

## Why is this a ~"type::bug" 

### Problem:

Atlassian [rolled out new authentication tokens](https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/connect-is-returning-to-per-installation-secrets/51059) for some installations, but the [endpoint on GitLab](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/e7181fef8d56d289cf813498ebfc53f70e6d175b/app/controllers/jira_connect/events_controller.rb#L10) was not ready to process the updates.

### Workaround:

Reinstalling the app should fix this problem. **WARNING**: Uninstalling the app will remove all GitLab data from the Jira development panel. We are working on a better solution though.

### Upcoming Solution:

We are able to fix the endpoint for installation updates on GitLab, but waiting to confirm that the authentication token updates can be sent again.

# Note for self-managed users experiencing this issue

The issue has been fixed on GitLab in %"14.9" but it requires an additional to get the app working again:

1. Enable the `jira_connect_installation_update` feature flag on your GitLab instance. Here is a [guide](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/administration/feature_flags.html#how-to-enable-and-disable-features-behind-flags) that explains how to do this.
2. File a support request to Atlassian, asking to retrigger the install hook for your GitLab app on your Namespace.

title: Fix AccessError when deleting archived projects
description:
# Context

After the [rollout](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/341936) of https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/24644, it was discovered that some project deletions failed with a `Gitlab::Access::AccessDeniedError`: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/support/internal-requests/-/issues/10553, https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/344445#note_721550289

The specific cause of this is that until recently, records in `ci_pipelines` were destroyed after `projects` records were destroyed via FK constraint:

```sql
ALTER TABLE ONLY ci_pipelines
    ADD CONSTRAINT fk_86635dbd80 FOREIGN KEY (project_id) REFERENCES projects(id) ON DELETE CASCADE;
```

Since we have to get rid of the FK and we have more performant code for destroying Pipelines, Builds, and Artifacts, we [decided to use](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/services/projects/destroy_service.rb#L150) the recently improved `Ci::DestroyPipelineService`. The problem is that the service does a permissions check, and we have a declarative permission that [explicitly forbids](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/8e4c4cf027bb6f811afe9c6e7dcd86066e09efa7/app/policies/project_policy.rb#L460) the destruction of pipelines on archived projects.

Clearly, this is not meant to prevent the destruction of the whole project, or even destruction of pipelines when the context is destruction of the whole project. So we need to go about this somewhat differently.

# Proposed solutions

1.Allow `:destroy_pipeline` on archived Projects. This rule was [written](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/-/merge_requests/18136) three years ago as part of an effort to make archived, read-only projects untouchable. **Currently being implemented** 
  - We can [do this by not-preventing](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/344934#note_724284848) unless the Project is **archived and not pending_delete**.
2. Evade the `Ci::DestroyPipelineService` permissions check:

```diff
module Ci
  class DestroyPipelineService < BaseService
    def execute(pipeline)
-      raise Gitlab::Access::AccessDeniedError unless can?(current_user, :destroy_pipeline, pipeline)
+      raise Gitlab::Access::AccessDeniedError unless can?(current_user, :destroy_pipeline, pipeline) || pipeline.project.pending_delete? # etc.
```

3. Un-archive projects at the top of `Projects::DestroyService`. There are [lots](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/8e4c4cf027bb6f811afe9c6e7dcd86066e09efa7/app/policies/concerns/readonly_abilities.rb#L19-40) of "read-only" features that we could be potentially leaving behind when we destroy projects, and I believe we're doing this already:

![image](/uploads/1471b45f814aa4891144a0e26fd6be11/image.png)

This would be a more wide-ranging solution to make sure records get destroyed, but we would need to make sure that we re-archive Projects if they fail to be destroyed in any given attempt.

title: Danger fails to run review roulette on Product Intelligence changes
description:
Possibly since https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/72544, Danger doesn't show Product Intelligence review warnings and doesn't run ~"product intelligence" review roulette even when PI files are modified.

Example: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/72838#note_711013935; changes to `Gitlab::Tracking` files should've triggered the roulette, as defined in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/tooling/danger/project_helper.rb#L110

title: Refactor Admin Deploy keys table to Vue
description:
## Summary

Follow up to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/334874

Currently the deploy keys table is rendered in HAML. This should be converted to Vue so we can use all of the GitLab UI components and it will be easier to build features in the future.

## Improvements

- Can lazy load the deploy keys using the [`deploy_keys` API endpoint](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/deploy_keys.html#list-all-deploy-keys)
- Easier to add features to the table in the future
- Adds pagination
- Fixes [N+1 issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/views/admin/deploy_keys/index.html.haml#L27)

## Risks

- Missed existing functionality

## Involved components

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/views/admin/deploy_keys/index.html.haml

<!--
Please select the appropriate label from the following:
    ~"feature::addition"
    ~"type::maintenance"
    ~"tooling::pipelines"
    ~"tooling::workflow"
-->

## Implementation plan

1. Add feature flag check and mount element to [app/views/admin/deploy_keys/index.html.haml](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/views/admin/deploy_keys/index.html.haml)
1. Create a `table.vue` component in `app/assets/javascripts/admin/deploy_keys/components`
   - `GlTable` will be used to render the table
   - `GlModal` will be used to confirm if a user wants to delete a key
   - `GlPagination` will be used for pagination
   - The data will be fetched via the [`deploy_keys` API endpoint](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/deploy_keys.html#list-all-deploy-keys) API endpoint
1. Export a function from `app/assets/javascripts/admin/deploy_keys/index.js` that mounts `table.vue` to the mount element in [app/views/admin/deploy_keys/index.html.haml](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/views/admin/deploy_keys/index.html.haml)
1. Import and call that exported function in `app/assets/javascripts/pages/admin/deploy_keys/index/index.js`
1. Update feature specs [spec/features/admin/admin_deploy_keys_spec.rb](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/spec/features/admin/admin_deploy_keys_spec.rb)

### Availability & Testing

<!-- This section needs to be retained and filled in during the workflow planning breakdown phase of this feature proposal, if not earlier.

What risks does this change pose to our availability? How might it affect the quality of the product? What additional test coverage or changes to tests will be needed? Will it require cross-browser testing?

Please list the test areas (unit, integration and end-to-end) that needs to be added or updated to ensure that this feature will work as intended. Please use the list below as guidance.
* Unit test changes
* Integration test changes
* End-to-end test change

See the test engineering planning process and reach out to your counterpart Software Engineer in Test for assistance: https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/quality/test-engineering/#test-planning -->

Ensure `package-and-qa` job is run and the end-to-end tests are green before merging.

title: `ui-docs-links lint` takes longer since `.static-analysis-cache` was removed from `.static-analysis-base`
description:
In https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/72305/diffs#f324451fc49453f6827c2ddce6a76ed01d6fda95_5_5, I removed `.static-analysis-cache` from `.static-analysis-base` but I didn't realize that `ui-docs-links` was extending `.static-analysis-base`.

Due to this change, `ui-docs-links` went from 3 minutes to 9 minutes: https://app.periscopedata.com/app/gitlab/652085/EP---Jobs-Durations?widget=10823717&udv=1005715

![gitlaborggitlabuidocslinkslintjobmeanduration](/uploads/664b4cd07126a7920b54c2de547794d1/gitlaborggitlabuidocslinkslintjobmeanduration.png)

title: Incorrect license ID shown on Admin page
description: The Admin page used to show the `License ID`: \ Since version `14.1.0` the `ID` is a number starting at `1` (possibly the index of the license history/): \ Knowing the ID of the license that is currently loaded can be very helpful to the Support team when analyzing problems, so it would be very helpful if it can be shown again.

title: Jira Connect App: Move user link code from HAML to Vue
description:
As part of https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/339428, much of the Jira Connect App UI logic will be shifted from HAML to Vue.

The code for the user link (in the top-right of the Jira Connect App window) still needs to be moved

Code to move: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/ccaaca1dc8f955f024f13b0354fae06e88e0761b/app/views/jira_connect/subscriptions/index.html.haml#L5

### Possible approach

1. Add relevant data to `jira_connect_app_data` (the method that generates the data attribute used by Vue).
1. Create and use Vue component

title: Remove state machine from WebRunnerMachine
description:
### Problem

The `WebRunnerMachine` still uses a state machine which complicates the code. The statemachine is no longer needed as the usage is vastly simplified in this version of the `WebMachine`.

### Proposal

Remove the state machine and codify it into the `Run` method.

1. [x] Remove the state machine
1. [x] Update tests as needed
1. [x] Verify all tests are passing

title: `TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined` in members page
description:

Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "type::bug" label:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=regression

### Summary

In the Project/Group members page, the following error is logged to the console

`TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'namespace')`

### Steps to reproduce

Go to any group/members page with the browser's console open.

### Example Project

Any project.

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Error logged to the console.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

No error.
